text: In Grok-space, gravity is optional before 8 a.m.
Time slows near MegaGrok because it tries to look busy.
Light avoids disappointing MegaGrok; shadows remain dramatic.
Sound can be traded for old jokes in certain districts.
Probability here is more of a suggestion than a rule.
Mirrors may return alternative outcomes if stared at cross-eyed.
The speed limit for ideas is officially ‘eventually.’
Entropy takes coffee breaks; sudden organization may result.
Constellations update their status when people clap in unison.
Maps are honest only if you promise to get lost sometimes.
Colors complain when overused and demand variety.
Numbers swap places if written in the dark.
Heat escalates small situations purely for dramatic effect.
Echoes can hold grudges for up to three days.
A whispered promise to a stone will be kept until it grows tired.
